title: Runtime: Always wake runner immediately once a new task is enqueued
Upgrade to Reqwest 0.11.0
body: This should finally mean that we're ready to release Tokio 1.0 support, and fix #339!

title: Improve documentation for `WsOther`
body:
- Mark with feature requirement
- Explain why it exists

Just to clarify why we decided to do this to minimize confusion.

---

Also, `reqwest` was released :tada:

title: Follow up on WebSocket connection support
body:
- Use re-exported `native_tls`
- Support `config.accept_invalid_certs` with `ws-rustls-tls`
- Run `ws` tests on Circle CI (mostly to make sure it compiles on both TLS)
- Remove catch all panic from WS connect
- Use `doc_cfg` on docs.rs (closes #365)
    - To try: `cargo +nightly rustdoc --lib --features=derive,ws,ws-native-tls -- --cfg docsrs`
- Fix broken links in docs
- Avoid panicking on connection failure (closes #369)

title: Fix v0.46.0 docs failing to build
body:
```
cargo rustdoc --lib --features "derive ws"
```
failed with the same error as docs.rs.

```
cargo rustdoc --lib --features "derive ws ws-native-tls"
```
worked.

Closes #366

We should consider `all-features = true` and #365.

title: AttachParams tweaks
body: found one inconsistency in the way the parameters were being built, and created a shorthand ctor for the `exec -it` equivalent.

title: Tokio 1.0
body:
Fixes #339

Currently uses an unreleased reqwest, since this requires https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/1076

title: Add WebSocket connection support and implement `/attach` and `/exec`
body:
Attempt to support WebSocket connection. 

@clux 

I'd like to know if this is on the right track before spending more time on it. ~~I _think_ it works, but haven't tried.~~ (outputting to stdout works, see `pod_attach` example)
This is based on https://github.com/clux/kube-rs/issues/229#issuecomment-751234315

I had to change `Config` a bit so that it's less coupled with `reqwest` to create `AsyncTlsConnector` for WebSocket connection when creating a `Client`.

---

- [x] Support WebSocket connection
    - [x] `native-tls`
    - [x] `rustls` (`accept_invalid_certs` not supported at the moment, need `rustls` 0.17.0+ and that requires updating `tokio` first)
- [x] Make WebSocket opt-in with `ws` feature
- [x] Decide how to implement `attach`/`exec` methods.
    - Added `AttachedProcess` struct. Need review/feedback.
- [x] Add `/attach` (see `pod_attach` example)
- [x] Add `/exec` (see `pod_exec` example)
- [x] Move most of `ws` specific code into a separate module. This should make it much easier to maintain.
- [x] Validate params. We only get 400 status error without any information when making connection :(
    - [At least one of `stdin`, `stdout`, `stderr` must be set](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/80be1d6c7217b99fb6ff083a190b44af53a628fc/pkg/kubelet/cri/streaming/server.go#L173-L175)
    - [`stderr` and `tty` cannot be both set because multiplexing is not supported](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/80be1d6c7217b99fb6ff083a190b44af53a628fc/pkg/kubelet/cri/streaming/server.go#L168-L172). `stderr` will be ignored.
- [x] ~~Make [`WebSocketConfig`](https://docs.rs/tungstenite/0.11.1/tungstenite/protocol/struct.WebSocketConfig.html) configurable.~~ Will do when there's a need.
- [x] Make the sizes of internal buffers configurable
- [x] Rename `api/streaming` to `api/remote_command`
- [x] Improve documentation for `AttachParams`
    - Explain how `stdin`, `stdout`, `stderr` allows access to writer/streams from `AttachedProcess`
- [x] Improve documentation for `AttachedProcess`
    - Explain how `stdin()`, `stdout()`, `stderr()` works

title: kube-derive rename kind_struct -> struct
body:
more memorable, ultimately a pretty major thing; what struct are we generating.
`kind_struct` is also not entirely clear, it's the struct for the custom resource describing a kind, so the specificity doesn't add anything here.

title: clarify inability to handle crate renames in kube-derive - closes #227
body: at least we know what we can't do atm.

title: Improve documentation readability
body:
- Fix typos
- Fix inconsistency
- Fix unclickable URLs
- Fix unintentional rendering (e.g., collapsed lists and paragraphs)
- Remove comments that shouldn't be in the docs (e.g., TODO rewrite examples)
- Add more useful links to jump to

Didn't fix missing periods for now unless the line had something else to fix.

title: make schema a default compile feature of kube-derive - for #355
body:
~~While the issue was closed, and the solution we have seems pretty solid, I can also see a case for people wishing to minimise their dependency trees a bit.~~

~~This adds a `#[kube(skip_crd)]` bool to `kube-derive` which cases `Foo::crd` to not be implemented.~~

~~Because of how good the `crd` generation now is, it's opt-out, rather than opt-in.~~

title: update rustfmt job to fix CI
body: queue a series of broken changes until actions understand what i want :-)

title: Generate schema for CRD v1
body:
Schema is generated with `schemars`.

Also fixed the location of `subresources` and `additionalPrinterColumns`.

Closes https://github.com/clux/kube-rs/issues/264

---

For deriving CRD v1, the spec struct must include `schemars::JsonSchema`. ~~The schemas for subresources are currently not generated, but it should be possible to add the status subresource by requiring the status struct to have `schemars::JsonSchema` and extracting the generated schema similar to the spec.~~ If there is a status subresource, its struct must include `JsonSchema` as well.

I'm not sure how to handle the new `schemars` dependency.

title: Controller: Parallel reconcilers
body:
Fixes #346, see that issue for the design discussion up until now.

- [X] Pending scheduler messages, see https://github.com/clux/kube-rs/issues/346#issuecomment-744000783
- [x] Use this to run multiple reconcilers

title: Make TypeMeta impl Debug + Eq + Hash
Runtime: Disable k8s-openapi default features
body:
On my laptop this brings `cargo build` down from 91s to 70s.

Note that this is slightly breaking: You will need to remove `default-features = false` from k8s-openapi *if* you depend on their `api` feature but have still tried to disable it for some reason.
